text:
I second the spacing/tabbing line indicators.

ability to toggle the error checking should be a temporary solution until a more performant error checking system can be employed.

I can’t say though I’ve seen a significant speed problem in the editor due to error checking. I probably would not personally be disabling it
I found the performance is much worse in Firefox than in Chrome. Don't know how much of that was due to the error checking.
That would explain why I’m not noticing the issue - I am usually in Chrome.
There are known issues with FF and React. For best performance I highly suggest using Chrome.
It’d be convenient if when you popped up the cmd+f find pane in the code editor, it was possible to close it. :wink: Personal preference.
You can only close it once you find what you’re looking for!
I think it knows what I’m looking for more than me then
It’s like the T.A.R.D.I.S. it doesn’t take you where you want to go, it takes you where you need to go.
You can close it using the ESC, i discovered this when i pressed all the buttons
haha thank you
Hey Jon!
I am 10000% all about this idea
I actually already started a public HubSpot Developer Extension: <https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension>
hmm then we need to consolidate our efforts, <@U7ADCU3BM> and I have been discussing this and he also now has an extension started.
Right now, mine has functionality to quickly reload pages with the `hsDebug=True` & `hsMoveJQueryToFooter=True` query string parameters
As well as grade a page through PSI
very cool, very useful. Yea I think we should all merge efforts on this.
Agreed
We also need a designer, mine is frankly terrible (i tried styling it nicely, but it is so bad)
:rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
Will I’ve installed the chrome extension. I get what you were saying about the graphics. :hamster:

<https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension/admin>

Mind adding me as a collaborator? Github username TheWebTech
Explode the `Menu` module out so you can have the same kind of editing that you get with a blog loop module. I'd love the ability to go further into the menu and be able to build it out more
<@U6W3H6YN8> when you get a chance can you add me as a collaborator got a feature branch started I’d like to push up to the repo.
<@U7AU6414J> thank you for this!
